title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic excelled off the bench, contributing 19 points, 11 rebounds, and three assists in Celtics' 124-105 win over Bulls.
Payton Pritchard stood out with 26 points, showing strong ball control and efficient shooting against the Chicago Bulls.
Anfernee Simons expressed openness to returning to Boston, highlighting his positive experience and relationships with the Celtics.

title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Seamus Culleton, an Irish man who overstayed his visa, has been held in ICE detention for five months.
His wife and lawyer claim poor conditions and legal missteps in his case; DHS argues he chose detention.
Culleton's pending green card application remains unresolved as ICE disputes due process claims and bail decision.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs faces possible release to save salary cap space despite a strong season.
Diggs, set to earn $20.6 million in 2026, could save the Patriots up to $20.8 million if released post-June 1.
Diggs faces legal issues, including an assault charge and a lawsuit, potentially impacting his future with the team.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard fire and police rescued a dog that fell through ice at Mill Pond on Tuesday night.
The rescue operation took under ten minutes, and the dog, Rufus, emerged uninjured.
A drone assisted firefighters in locating Rufus, ensuring a swift and successful rescue.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Signal issues caused delays on all 12 MBTA commuter rail lines Wednesday, with some trains delayed up to 50 minutes.
More than 25 commuter rail trains were canceled due to signal issues affecting the system throughout Wednesday.
The Blue Line experienced a power issue requiring shuttle buses between Orient Heights and Wonderland, resolved by Wednesday evening.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Former Worcester councilor Etel Haxhiaj found guilty of assaulting a police officer, sentenced to six months probation.
Haxhiaj acquitted of interfering with police during the May 8 ICE-related incident in Worcester, Massachusetts.
Prosecutors differentiate between Haxhiaj's conduct toward police and her right to protest ICE actions.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue will open its BlueHouse BOS lounge at Logan Airport's Terminal C near gate C23 this summer.
The Boston lounge, at 11,000 square feet, will be 40% larger than the New York JFK lounge.
BlueHouse BOS will offer complimentary food, a full-service bar, and private workspaces with free WiFi.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots predicted to draft Utah offensive tackle Caleb Lomu with No. 31 pick in 2026 NFL Draft.
Lomu, a versatile 6-foot-6, 304-pound lineman, didn't allow a sack in 2025, strengthening his draft appeal.
Patriots' poor offensive line performance in Super Bowl LX underscores need for reinforcements like Lomu.

title: New Red Sox Caleb Durbin models his game after former Boston MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Caleb Durbin, acquired by the Red Sox in a trade, aims to follow Dustin Pedroia's playing style and approach.
Durbin, a 5-foot-7 infielder, is known for his defense and contact hitting, with 50 strikeouts in 2025.
Durbin hopes to develop more power at Fenway, after hitting 11 home runs and a .387 slugging percentage last season.

title: Jaylen Brown offers Drake Maye advice on how to ‘level up’ after  championship heartbreak
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jaylen Brown advised Patriots' quarterback Drake Maye to use Super Bowl loss as motivation to improve.
Brown shared his experience of bouncing back from NBA Finals defeats, emphasizing personal growth and resilience.
Brown encouraged Maye to find personal peace and focus on developing his skills further to overcome setbacks.
